name: typical
posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: showing all the characteristics that you would usually expect from a particular group of things

example.eg: I must look like the typical tourist with my shorts and my camera.
example.egtrans: 穿着短裤，带着相机，我看上去一定像个典型的游客。

example.eg: This kind of hot and spicy food is very typical of the food in the south of the country.
example.egtrans: 这种辛辣食品是该国南部具代表性的食物。

example.eg: Typical symptoms would include severe headaches, vomiting and dizziness.
example.egtrans: 典型的症状包括剧烈的头疼、呕吐和眩晕。

trans_examp.trans_en: showing all the bad characteristics that you expect from someone or something, often in a way that is annoying
trans_examp.trans_cn: （不良品质等）特有的，一向如此的，不出所料的

example.eg: It's just typical of Dan to spend all that money on the equipment and then lose interest two months later.
example.egtrans: 丹就是这种人，先把所有的钱花在买装备上，两个月以后又失去了兴趣。

example.eg: "He called at the last minute to say he wasn't coming." "Typical!"
example.egtrans: “他在最后时刻打电话说不来了。”“他老是这样！”
